description: This short paper draws on narratives from communities who participated in research in Fiji and Papua New Guinea.  The findings suggest that strong gender norms may constrain women’s agency and their ability to be economically independent.
keywords: economic-empowermet, enhancing-agency, land-sea-and-livelihoods, pacific-women, short-paper, social-norms
name: ‘What Is Mine Is Yours’: Women’s Asset Control and Decision-Making in Fiji and PNG
